DataElement.preferredName: Anticoagulant Agent Not Low Molecular Weight Heparin Administered Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator to signify whether or not the patient is receiving anti-coagulants other than low-molecular weight heparin.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Anticoagulant Agent Not Low Molecular Weight Heparin Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any agent capable of preventing blood clot formation._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._Substances comprised of fragmented heparin molecules derived from unfractionated heparin that bind to antithrombin III with a molecular weight ranging from 1000 to 10,000 daltons, which causes changes in property from unfractionated heparin, including decreased protein binding, enhanced bioavailability, decreased platelet interaction, and decreased binding to thrombin.(NCI)_The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Agents that prevent blood clotting. Naturally occurring agents in the blood are included only when they are used as drugs.

Concepts.definition: Any agent capable of preventing blood clot formation.

Property.preferredName: Negation Low Molecular Weight Heparin Administered
Property.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:Substances comprised of fragmented heparin molecules derived from unfractionated heparin that bind to antithrombin III with a molecular weight ranging from 1000 to 10,000 daltons, which causes changes in property from unfractionated heparin, including decreased protein binding, enhanced bioavailability, decreased platelet interaction, and decreased binding to thrombin.(NCI):The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.

Substances comprised of fragmented heparin molecules derived from unfractionated heparin that bind to antithrombin III with a molecular weight ranging from 1000 to 10,000 daltons, which causes changes in property from unfractionated heparin, including decreased protein binding, enhanced bioavailability, decreased platelet interaction, and decreased binding to thrombin.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription:
Created for ABTC eligibility checklist for the 1202 Mk-1775 study per request by J.Zhao. mc 5/14/13 Released per approval by Jason. mc 6/13/13
Moved to ABTC context mc 4/7/14

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is the patient receiving anti
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient receiving anti-coagulants other than low-molecular weight heparin?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ABTC-1602 Question
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient taking warfarin, factor Xa inhibitors, and direct thrombin inhibitors? (Low molecular weight heparin and prophylactic low dose warfarin are permitted)
